Detailed Description

This class allows access to a texture layer.

Member Function Documentation

ComObjectWrap< DX::Texture > TerrainTextureLayer::createBlendTexture ( TerrainTextureLayerPtr  layer0,
TerrainTextureLayerPtr  layer1,
TerrainTextureLayerPtr  layer2,
TerrainTextureLayerPtr  layer3,
bool  allowSmallBlend,
bool  compressTexture,
bool *  smallBlended 
) [static]

Blend up to four TerrainTextureLayers to create a single texture.

Any layer can be missing, but we assume that the if there is a layer then layer 0 exists. We also assume that if there are layers then they are all the same size.

Parameters:
layer0 Layer 0.
layer1 Layer 1.
layer2 Layer 2.
layer3 Layer 3.
allowSmallBlend If true then we can pack into 8 or 16 bit textures if possible.
compressTexture If true then the texture is compressed.
smallBlended Set to true if the texture could be packed.
Returns:
The blended texture.

void TerrainTextureLayer::defaultUVProjections ( Vector4 &  u,
Vector4 &  v 
) [static]

This gets the default u and v projections.

Parameters:
u This is set to the default u-projection.
v This is set to the default v-projection.

virtual bool Terrain::TerrainTextureLayer::hasUVProjections (  )  const [pure virtual]

This function is used to determine whether the TerrainTextureLayer has u and v projections?

Returns:
True if setting/getting the u, v projections are allowed.

Implemented in Terrain::TerrainTextureLayer1, and Terrain::TerrainTextureLayer2.

virtual bool Terrain::TerrainTextureLayer::load ( DataSectionPtr  section,
std::string *  error = NULL 
) [pure virtual]

This function loads the texture layer from a DataSection.

Parameters:
section The section to load from.
error If an error occurs during loading then this will be set to an error string.
Returns:
True if the load was successful.

Implements Terrain::TerrainMap< uint8 >.
